summary: Espionage, categorized under defence, refers to the clandestine activities aimed at obtaining confidential information, typically for national security purposes. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, espionage raises significant concerns regarding the protection of sensitive data and the safeguarding of state secrets. The EU has established various directives and regulations to combat espionage, ensuring cooperation among member states in intelligence sharing and cybersecurity measures. These legal instruments aim to enhance the resilience of EU institutions against espionage threats, thereby promoting stability and security within the Union. Effective counter-espionage strategies are crucial for maintaining public trust and protecting democratic values.
